title: [K-12] Analysis of Data-Driven Mathematics Learning Design in Distributed Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics knowledge (primary school level) and basic digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: Learners complete project assignments across digital platforms and receive personalized learning pattern analyses via learning analytics tools. They systematically document and share mathematical problem-solving processes.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze their own learning data generated from three or more e-learning platforms to improve math learning efficiency by 20% or more.

Over 2–4 weeks, learners select one real-world problem (e.g., budget allocation, space utilization) from school or community life, represent it using mathematical models (equations, graphs, statistics), and propose ≥3 solutions based on data collection and analysis.
Learners can manage study time 15% more efficiently by utilizing personalized recommended strategies presented in learning analytics reports.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
